intro: Linum acuticarpum, commonly known as the sharp-fruit flax, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Linaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its capsules contain numerous small, oval seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. Linum acuticarpum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
